page.title: 11Crime in Lydden
page.content: The most common crime in Lydden is vandalism and criminal damage.Most of these offences are committed by a small group of teenagers.Other crimes include minor burglaries,traffic offences,sheep rustling and attacks on sheep by dogs which can be a serious problem.Some of the criminals are local but Lydden is also affected occasionally by travelling offenders who come off the A2,commit the crime,and move swiftly on.Any youngsters who are caught are taken home by the police and their parents are spoken to.Older detainees are taken to Dover Police Station.The rural policeman is occasionally attacked but the person involved is nearly always drunk.The regular policeman has a part time lady constable to help him.She is a typist during the day and is called upon to assist when necessary.
